intro: Lycomormium fuscatum, commonly known as the black-stemmed lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its dark, leathery thallus and a distinct, often glossy appearance. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a cyanobacterium or green alga, which allows it to thrive in various environments. It is typically found on bark, stones, and soil surfaces in temperate regions. Its slow growth and ability to survive in harsh conditions make it an important indicator species for environmental health.
